channel.title: Deltascape dig emote
channel.description:
[code=java] case 952: c.sM("You dig.."); c.setAnimation(831); break;[/code]
This is my current dig case for deltascape, the problem is that when you click "dig" the character doesn't dig once, he continues digging for awhile.
I do not know how to fix this, there is no clear error. Help is appreciated.

item.title: Deltascape dig emote
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

Sinned:

Oh I see. Try adding a timer.

if (System.currentTimeMillis() - c.foodDelay < 900) c.setAnimation(831); else if (System.currentTimeMillis() - c.foodDelay > 900) c.foodDelay = System.currentTimeMillis(); c.setAnimation(-1); c.sM("You dig..");
I’m not sure how to use timers, this doesn’t do any animation for digging.

I really want this little thing completed.

Read full topic

item.title: Deltascape dig emote
item.dc:creator: @Sinned Sinned
item.description:
@Sinned wrote:

Oh I see. Try adding a timer.

Read full topic

item.title: Deltascape dig emote
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

[quote=“Sinned, post:2, topic:442757”]Do you possibly have another animation method? setAnimation loops it, so maybe one called animation (or whatever) simply does it once. Take a look through your methods.

It’s either that or you could set up a timer that is the same length as the animation, and then do c.setAnimation(-1); after the timer runs out.[/quote]
setAnimation doesn’t loop for other emotes, it seems like only this one. The only other animation method that I could find is pEmote, which loops for every emote.

Read full topic

item.title: Deltascape dig emote
item.dc:creator: @Sinned Sinned
item.description:
@Sinned wrote:

Do you possibly have another animation method? setAnimation loops it, so maybe one called animation (or whatever) simply does it once. Take a look through your methods.

It’s either that or you could set up a timer that is the same length as the animation, and then do c.setAnimation(-1); after the timer runs out.

Read full topic
